result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley W.I. Markin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from def's RCSD Jail canteen account

Defendant Bradley W.I. Markin in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA has requested payment of rest. from def's canteen account.  Def has brought a check to court from that account.  Def's request for modification of sentence denied.  Clerk receives rest. payment.
Payment hearing at 07-01-2015 02:30 pm
Letter from Court to BM re. furlough
Letter from BM to judge in response to sentence

ADDRESS INFO for Bradley W.I. Markin
Current: 1500 Seminary Street Apt 205, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 03-04-2015)
Prior: 11809 Excelsior Road, Blue River, WI 53518
email from VW Coordinator to clerk re restitution amounts in 14CM59 and 14CF80

2 cases called together for status/sentencing:  14CM59 and 14CF80.  Attorney David William Franker in court for Defendant Bradley W.I. Markin. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bradley W.I. Markin in court, in custody.  Counsel state the parties' recommendation of 4 mo jail imposed/stayed on counts 2 and 3 of 14CF80 for dismissal of count 1 in that case with 2 years probation that would include $1400 restitution to DG; def will also plead to counts 1, 2, and 3 for dismissal/read in of count 4 in 14CM59.  Atty. Franker states that the def would be entitled to 74 days credit in 14CF80.  Court has concerns with the jt recommendation and informs the parties that Court will not follow the plea agreement.  Court has noted def's extensive history which includes burglary counts; notes that, with the amount of credit, the jt recommendation would result in basically no penalty at all.  Knowing that, Def states he still wants to proceed with the plea and sentencing.  

To counts 2 and 3, theft and bail jumping, in 14CF80, def pleads no contest.  To count 1 in 14CM59, def pleads guilty.  To counts 2 and 3 of the same case, def pleads no contest.  Court's colloquy re pleas.  Finding of guilty on all five counts.

Counsel address the Court.

Court notes consideration of dismissed read-in counts, including DRI burglary count, in pronouncing sentencing.  

Sentence:  

14CF80/count 2 - 9 mo jail; count 3 - 90 days jail, consecutive, for total of 1 year.  Straight sentence with huber.  Credit:  74 days.  
14CM59 -  sentence withheld for 3 year probation.  0 days credit in the event of revocation.  Conditions:  cognitive intervention class.  Pay restitution in both cases:  $1400 for 14CF80 (to be collected by the clerk) and $102.89 for 14CM89 (to be collected by agent).  Attend, pay for, and complete any counseling or programs ordered by agent; follow all rules.  Pay costs - not DNA surcharges.  Def to write letters of apology to the victims with those to be submitted to the agent.  

Court's intent is for clerk to collect the restitution in 14CF80, the jail sentence case, as well as the costs.  Probation to collect restitution in 14CM59.
Status conference at 03-02-2015 10:00 am

2 cases called together (14CM59 & 14CF80). Defendant Bradley W.I. Markin in custody in court with attorney David William Franker. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA gives status of cases. 14CF80 def wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Colloquy re. waiver of prelim. Court accepts waiver of prelim. Information is filed, defense waives formal reading. Court informs def of the charges brought forth on the information. NG pleas entered.  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Status conference at 02-18-2015 11:00 am

Attorney David W. Franker appeared by phone means for Defendant Bradley W.I. Markin. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bradley W.I. Markin appeared by video means.  14CF80/adjourned initial - formal reading waived; charges and max. penalties stated; prelim rights stated; prelim time limits waived; status requested and set.  14CM59/status - further status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance at 12-29-2014 09:30 am

Defendant Bradley W.I. Markin appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Franker not present.  Court questions def as to whether he contacted Atty. Franker.  Def states he contacted SPD office; they said they'd let him know of the appearance.  Court notes that Dec. 29th at 9:30 had also been given as a date for this matter; assumes that Atty. Franker is appearing that date instead of this one.  Matter adj. to 12/29 at 9:30.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 29, 2014 at 09:30 am.
No contact with David Gingrich or Allen Borntreger
Adjourned initial appearance at 12-23-2014 11:30 am

Defendant Bradley W.I. Markin via video from RC jail without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. 2 cases called together (14CM59 & 14CF80). DA Harper gives status of case, requests bond in 14CF59 be reinstated as a warrant was authorized in this matter due to nonappearance at plea/sentencing. In 14CF80 DA requests $1000 cash bond with no contacts with DG or AB. Def requests complaint be sent to the jail, no objections to bond. 14CM80, court orders $1000 cash bond with no contact with DB or AB  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 23, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Attorney David W. Franker in court for Defendant Bradley W.I. Markin. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bradley W.I. Markin not in court.  2:34 p.m.  This matter was set for 2:30 today.  Atty. F states he does not know why def not here.  Warrant requested and ordered.
